Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient to SMU”
Reviews.Author: eksdhs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in mid-April for an event at SMU. It was a convenient location for our purposes and we felt safe and secure with the locked garage. (All the security warning signs made me question if we should feel safe, but the neighborhood seemed fine.) We stayed in a Deluxe King studio which has a sofa bed in the living area, a large walk-in closet, and a well-equipped kitchenette. It was identical to the rooms we've stayed in at other Hyatt House locations. Some observations: Front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. The location of the lone TV made it impossible to be viewed from both the bed and sofa at the same time. If it were installed differently, perhaps it could. I was surprised to find they charge $8/night for self parking as other properties in the area provide it complementary. The breakfast is adequate, but nothing special. We were not there for the evening social hour.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt House/Hyatt Home a great place to stay! Would gladly return.”
Reviews.Author: GFTravels
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights at the Hyatt House Lincoln Park in Dallas just a couple of weeks ago, and I cannot say enough good things about our experience. To address the roach comment made by a previous review--I saw nothing of the kind while we were there. The hotel is in an upscale neighborhood with a large shopping mall and many nice restaurants (about 1 mile away) in the vicinity. We were visiting Dallas for medical reasons, and the close proximity to Texas Presbyterian was a huge plus (about 5 miles away). The only downside might be for light sleepers--the hotel is just off of a busy highway, so there is a little traffic noise, but it did not keep us up or wake us up when we were there (we stayed on the top floor and this may have helped). The staff was very kind, efficient, and helpful. I needed some medical records copied and they did so at no charge. The breakfast in the mornings has eggs, meat, fruits, breads--it isn't four-star dining but it is a money and time saver. In the evening there are finger foods, wine and beer at no charge. Two of the evenings we were there, this was our dinner. We stayed at this type of Hyatt so I could have a kitchen to cook gluten free meals; the kitchen was up-to-date and well-equipped. I was very happy to see stainless steel cookware and glass bowls instead of cheap plastic and aluminum. There is a Tom Thumb grocery 1/4 mi away and a Whole Foods by the mall. The bed was very comfortable, there are 2 TVs in the room and a DVD player, as well as a desk. My husband worked in the room during the days when I was gone, and he was very content (not an easy accomplishment). There is a morning shuttle to locations within short drives of the hotel and another in the evening, and this transportation was a godsend to me. The parking garage (gated and 3 covered floors) is attached to the hotel ($8 per day with in and out privileges). Very convenient. There is an outdoor pool/spa (nothing fancy or huge) in the courtyard, small workout room (elliptical, 2 treadmills, free weights, exercise bike), and a business center in the lobby area. I think our room was nicer in person than online photos depict, but it was more basic than the Hyatt Regency. We will be back! (NOTE: the price drops in increments depending on the length of your stay after the 4th night. If you are traveling for medical reasons, mention that as well.)

Reviews.Title: “Good experiences in the past - but concerned about recent review”
Reviews.Author: NANCY B
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel about twice per year since 2002, when it was the Bradford, and then Summerfield, and I intended to book a room for this June. But, now I am concerned about the previous review about the giant cockroach. I am even more concerned about the response from the General Manager. She did not address the bug problem at all - just asked the guest to contact her directly. I previously lived in Texas for 10 years, and understand that Texas has giant cockroaches, but I need to know there is not a cockroach problem in the hotel. I would not be able to sleep there if I saw one. I'm sure others would like reassurance also.

Reviews.Title: “I was ok until a roach the size of Rhode Island ran across the bedroom floor”
Reviews.Author: FetchEars
Reviews.Content: This a nice place for extended stays. The free happy hour is cool and the location is great. The rooms ( mine is a one bedroom ) look like cheap apartments with dingy white paint and downscale furnishings. The beds are very comfortable and the pillows are good quality. But y'all I just killed a huge roach in my bedroom. The missed wakeup call is one thing but this is unacceptable. The staff seems caring so maybe they will look into this unfortunate issue SOON. RL

Reviews.Title: “Fun place to stay”
Reviews.Author: LCU-ACUMom
Reviews.Content: I booked a room to share with my niece to celebrate her 13th birthday. Colors, furniture, tv were fun and modern and she really liked that. We sat in the hot tub (on a really cold night in February!) and watched movies and ate popcorn prepared in the very complete kitchenette. Bathroom was a good size, and there was an extra sink, so we could both get ready at the same time. Very comfortable beds.Breakfast was really good, lots to choose from. I did not hear any traffic noise at all. I think I would rather stay here than with family! (don't tell them I said that!)

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: USMuseFan
Reviews.Content: had a business stay here. Beds were comfy. Rooms were clean. Breakfast buffet was only ok. If your room isn't by the elevators its a long walk. Internet was touch and go. Good location. I like the secured parking.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable suite hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lancburm
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times. It happens to be conveniently located near our office in Dallas. The staff is very attentive and the rooms are comfortable. The workout room is quite small but has both aerobic equipment and weights. The hotel is very close to Northpark Mall where you can find several restaurants and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY FROM THIS PROPERTY!!!”
Reviews.Author: B A
Reviews.Content: The majority of the rooms are a few yards away from an extremely busy freeway (I-75) and look like a women's prison or worse, an old style delapidated dorm room. Front desk did comp the room since I didn't sleep a wink but only a few rooms are quiet enough to sleep in and are the size of a large closet. The front looks good but that's where it stops, the hallway near the market center/atm smelled like it had been flooded and never cleaned and the rest of the place looked like an institution. JUST CREEPY!!!! STAY AWAY!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great clean, new and convenient place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SarahbethSP
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at this Hyatt for the TX-OU game weekend in Dallas. The hotel was a little difficult to find although you can spot it from the highway, just have to make sure you catch the Caruth Haven light. The hotel is very clean and looks new. The staff at the front desk is extremely kind and helpful. They called us a cab for Saturday night which made getting around much easier which the large crowds in the city for the game. The parking is in a very nice and safe covered garage attached to the building for only $8/day, much better than the $25/day valet at any downtown hotel. You can also park across the street for free. The room was comfortable with a living area and kitchen. The closet was large and plenty of room. We enjoyed being able to access all areas of the city including Uptown and North Park Mall within 7 minutes. We will definitely be staying here again for ease of stay and comfortable beds and great service!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - close to SMU & shopping.”
Reviews.Author: crl07
Reviews.Content: Great location, especially if visiting SMU. We go several times a year and really appreciate their SMU rate. In fact, we are visiting in a couple of weeks for our first stay of the semester.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: finditapt
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very clean. I stayed in the room design of the picture shown. It is very clean. Halls were clean, and everything smelled good. I hate when you go in a hotel, and it smells musty the moment you walk in. Well, you won't have this issue at this hotel. Nice kitchen with all appliances. The ladies at the front desk were very friendly. Breakfast buffet stayed well stocked. Had biscuits, sausage gravy, eggs, cereals, oatmeal, breads, sausage, salsa, cheese, many flavor juices, fresh fruit/diced. Nice secure parking garage attached to building. If you stay M-Th, they have special free food/drinks on nightly buffet. Previous reviewer commented about caulking around their toilet needing work...no issue with mine.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable....but....”
Reviews.Author: avrumeleh
Reviews.Content: We came to Dallas for a family gathering and stayed here with other members of the family and enjoyed ourselves. It's a nicely located, comfortable hotel with a very....very...friendly and helpful staff. My only problem with the hotel was that the bathroom did need a bit of sprucing up with caulking around the tub that boasted a number of different colors....including, and I'm not kidding...peppermint blue! And, there was that nemesis of feeling really good in a hotel....mildew on the grouting between the tiles in the shower. They really ought to address that. And, be aware that there is no bar in the hotel and that would have made the comaraderie all the better. But, even with that...you'd do just fine at the hotel which is just a five minute walk of a few restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “amazing find”
Reviews.Author: ChicaTexas_USA
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for 7 nights while working on my home. I'm so glad I tried this hotel as it really is a great find in Dallas. This hotel has ample parking and a pool - a small business center - breakfast is good as is the evening social. Location is great - across the street from northpark mall and you can walk to the cheescake factory! however the best thing about this hotel are the staff - they are very helpful and friendly- when i had to expend my stay they were helpful despite there being an almost full house. My room overlooked the courtyard so it was quiet and a good size - pull out sofa bed was ok according to my daughter. the fitness center was great and there is also a little store onsite My only slight complaint was the housekeeping - our floor was done very late in the day so we were usually back in the room before it was clean. However this is my new hotel for my out of town guests and i have already recommended it to a friend coming next month. overall great value for money and you cant beat the location

Reviews.Title: “Close location to highway and easy walking distance to restaurants and grocery store.”
Reviews.Author: LittleAppleRed
Reviews.Content: Easy parking deck on site with easy access to hotel, fairly clean. Nice hot breakfasts...I didn't stay for weekday dinner. Fairly close to a Cheesecake Factory and a Mexican food place (forgot name)...and a grocery store with wine shop (Tom Thumb store). Only drawback was loud blower in wall for heat/air. It rattled on and off...finally just turned entire thing off. Loud guests out in courtyard were, very quickly, quieted by hotel staff. That was appreciated. Maid service not that great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for the area”
Reviews.Author: FunTraveler25
Reviews.Content: We were somewhat reluctant to book a room here based on Trip Advisor ratings. However we were VERY PLEASED with the hotel and their staff. The hotel is very attractive and clean. The room suites were well designed and comfortable. The hot breakfast was well presented and tasty. We will definitely stay here in the furure.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value. I would gladly stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Sonomamon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Summerfield Suites Lincoln Park from 1/25 - 2/8/2011. Keep in mind that this is Dallas, and the Super Bowl was 2/6/11, in Arlington. I was in town for the NFL Experience, at the Dallas Convention Center, about 7 minutes away from the hotel. It was less than $90 per night. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. I shipped and received many, many packages during my stay, and they were always very gracious about everything. I used the business center every night, to print packing slips, and they were always there to help with paper jams, or extra paper. The room was spacious, with a living room and office area, complete with free high-speed internet (wired or wireless - your choice). There was a kitchenette, complete with microwave, dishwasher, two burners,a full fridge/freezer, and all the dishes, pots, pans, and utensils you could want. No oven, however. The living area has a comfy sectional couch, w/ pullout bed. Also has a flat-screen TV, and a thing that you can connect various audio/video devices to. The office area was just inside the door, and was a desk, lamp, and bulletin board. The bedroom, has a door, and has a very comfy bed, flat-screen tv, and two nightstands. The mirror/sink area is outside the bathroom, and is very well lit. There are drawers and a counter for your stuff. The bathroom is your basic bathroom, with a toilet and a tub/shower. The shower has good water pressure - always a plus. They have free breakfast buffet every morning. Not just fruits and cereal, although those are available. They have sausages, ham, pancakes, muffins, etc. They have an evening social most nights, and that is another buffet, which also includes wine & beer. Some of the evening offerings were: tacos, pizza, fresh cookies, etc. Parking was free, but I think that was just because of the length of our stay. First two floors of parking are covered, 3rd floor not. This mattered, since it snowed while I was there. There is a gym on the 1st floor, with an upright bike, a recumbant bike, 2 treadmills, and an elliptical. Towels and water are provided. Even a scale! There is a small market on the 1st floor, with microwaveable food, ice cream, soft drinks, etc. Grab what you want, take it to the front desk, and charge it to your room. Minor complaints: The elevators are extremely slow. I used the stairs whenever possible. The railings in the staircases are not all securely attached to the walls - be careful! The housekeeping staff did a great job, and added nice touches like: folding a shirt I left out, washing dishes I left in the sink, and making a fan out of a bathroom towel. I'm in no hurry to return to Dallas, but if I do return, I'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware Overbooking!”
Reviews.Author: Tim_in_Boulder
Reviews.Content: We reserved a two bedroom suite, because it's the only sane way we can travel with our young children. This reservation was confirmed by a credit card, AND had also been confirmed for late arrival the day before. Yet the night before the reservation, we were informed that our room wasn't going to be available. They offered us two unconnected rooms instead. This turned what was going to be a relaxing vacation into a stressful logistics challenge every evening, with kids waking each other up and no one getting enough sleep. We picked this room -- and this particular WEEK -- because it was what we needed, not a pair of unconnected rooms! They didn't even OFFER to find us equivalent accommodations elsewhere! If you want your reservation to actually MEAN something, then avoid this hotel! To top it off, the noise in the hotel from the adjacent highway was not fun -- sirens going late into the night would have really kept me awake if the really loud refrigerator and air conditioning weren't competing for that privilege.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, convenient and reasonably-priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kizzydc
Reviews.Content: From the moment I stepped into this hotel with my group, the hotel staff have been friendly and welcoming. I particularly would like to recognize Quentin at the front desk who is cheery and helpful, no matter what time of day or how busy the hotel is! The rooms are clean and huge, kitchenettes are useful, and the daily breakfast seals the deal. I would stay here again in a heartbeat when returning to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Very Accommodating”
Reviews.Author: Julia1966
Reviews.Content: My father and uncle were the actual guests in the hotel. I am in the hotel business and had orginially booked them at a different hotel location across town. When I arrived ahead of them in Dallas, my cousin shared with me that they had stayed at this hotel location last year and is much more convenient to my cousins home. We stopped by the hotel to investigate the availability and learned that they had only one room left with two double beds. The GM and Sales Manager were great in accommodating their needs and I absolutely appreciate their hospitality 100%. We will stay only at this property each time we visit Dallas!!! Great Job to their entire staff!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: capodaca
Reviews.Content: My husband and I needed a hotel with a kitchen for our special diets. These are very nice rooms, super comfy Hyatt bed's, flat screen tv's , great breakfast ( eggs, not just sugar ) and you could eat dinner at the happy hour with free beer and wine. The staff was super with big smiles and a helpful attitude. The grocery store is around the corner and North Park mall across from that. T

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel, best location”
Reviews.Author: covingtonhs94
Reviews.Content: This is a very clean hotel. Service is wonderful. Right around the corner from a shopping center, and across the expressway from the upscale Northpark Center Mall. I feel very safe staying here alone. Free breakfast (traditional or continental) work out room, etc. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Corrie1013
Reviews.Content: Normally, before staying in any hotel, I always check Trip Advisor. I was making a last minute business trip and was told this hotel was closest to where the office building was that my meeting was being held at. I made the reservation through my company's travel agency and off I went- not knowing what to expect, having never stayed at a Hyatt Summerfield Suites. The hotel and staff were beyond my expectations. When I arrived, I was greeted by a very friendly (and funny) desk clerk. When I arrived in my room, I was surprised by how large it was. I loved the big couch and a curled up on it later that night with the extra blanket I found in the HUGE walk in closet...who gets a walk in closet at a HOTEL??? That was awesome! I didn't have a car for my trip so I was kind of stuck at the hotel that evening and I was wondering what I was going to do for dinner...didn't want to wait 45 - 90 minutes for a food delivery service, so I went downstairs to the evening "social" not expecting much. They had soup (chili), salad, pizza, chips, bread, veggies, fruit, cookies, beer and wine. It was plenty to fill me up for dinner. Some chili and a slice of pizza and I was good... The bed was big and comfy and fluffy- shower's water pressure was great...big kitchen for a 'suites' hotel. I could go on and on. One of the biggest things that I appreciated was the next morning-after the hot breakfast- I asked the clerk at the desk about the shuttle. I didn't need to be at my meeting until 10:00 am...but the shuttle stopped running in the morning at 9:00am. The clerk made some calls and went out of her way to arrange to have a driver meet me at the time I needed to go. I really felt like she went above and beyond what I would normally expect. From most hotels in the past, I have been told, Sorry- that's our policy. Can't help. So, overall, I had a fantastic experience at this hotel...enough that I would come on Trip Advisor to write a review.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, especially for this part of town!”
Reviews.Author: happybethel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 6 nights and really enjoyed it. I think this hotel may be one of the best values for staying in a desirable part of Dallas. There were a few things that were not perfect, but overall the room was quite comfortable and very well located. I grew up in Dallas and know the area pretty well. This hotel is located close to exciting destinations including downtown and SMU while remaining in a very safe part of Dallas. Youâ€™re walking distance from a grocery store and Northpark Mall. There are tons of great restaurants in this area too. They have a parking garage and there is a fee of $6 a day to use it. We did not have a problem finding free parking on the street, and we werenâ€™t worried at all about our car. Summerfield Suites is definitely not the fanciest place Iâ€™ve ever stayed, Iâ€™d recommend it for someone looking for safe, clean, and reasonably nice accommodations. We appreciated the beds, large closet, rotating television, internet, desk, gym, and kitchenette. Itâ€™s a mid-grade hotelâ€”far from cheesy or sketchy, but not necessarily a luxury spa. Iâ€™ll planning on staying there next time I need a hotel in Dallas. If you arenâ€™t familiar with Dallas, Iâ€™d be careful of staying anywhere too far south or west of hereâ€”especially anything near Harry Hines.

Reviews.Title: “Historic building, clean rooms but not quite sound-proof”
Reviews.Author: banjo518
Reviews.Content: As with many historic hotels, this one is no difference in its inferior sound-proof walls. I could hear people talking in the room upstairs. Be sure to get a room on the top floor. However, the upkeep of the hotel is quite nice. We book a one-bedroom suite-quite roomy with a living area, kitchen and 2 HDTVs. The breakfast is included-passable with the usual scrambled eggs, sausage, French toast and yogurt. Billy the front desk clerk is quite helpful while Deanna was a bit suck-up. It's in walking distance to nearby Barnes and Noble plaza and mall.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: rdpintexas
Reviews.Content: Got this place for $65/night ($50 priceline bid plus their upcharges and taxes). Nice Ikea-ish furniture, nice TV, mini-kitchen, etc. All in all I would recommend. $6 parking charge though but the garage was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!! What more needs to be said???”
Reviews.Author: MrJr1986
Reviews.Content: Cute, but simple dÃ©cor among all the necessary amenities made this an experience to remember - very different from most hotels, even suites. Delicious breakfast â€“ highly recommend. There was also a nice pool encompassed by big trees and the hotel buildings. Last by not least, the hotel is right next to NorthPark Center â€“ one of the best high-end malls in America. Each, year this mall has fashion shows and other fun events. There are great restaurants next door and I see now that I missed out on a great specialâ€¦ the Shopperâ€™s Package. Next time, I guess. Very quiet considering its location. If you need to do laundry, there is a facility on-site, as well as a fitness center. It is just like an apartment building and can be extended-stay as need be. Even though it says â€œsuites,â€� it is affordable and has a lot to offer. Donâ€™t rule it out, promise it will be a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for hidden charges”
Reviews.Author: spicew00d
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times this year and always been pleased. This time the front desk informed me that there is a $6 a night parking charge - they do not tell you this when making a reservation or on the web site but pencil it in when you check in. The clerk stated that this is a new charge. On Friday night there were three cars vandalized in the "secure" parking. Will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very spacious and convenient”
Reviews.Author: AustLesConner
Reviews.Content: The suite was extremely large- as big as my last apartment! It is convenient- right next to the Northpark Center and other restaurants/shopping. The staff was friendly, the kitchen is fully-equipped, and the shower is nice and large. There is a pool but it was a little cool for us to use it. Breakfast was about average but not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, a little loud from freeway and smoking”
Reviews.Author: 1travel5MV
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying we had a decent, but not an amazing nor great stay at the Hyatt Summerfield. Our flight on American arrived from Los Angeles at midnight, so we were tired and anxious to get to bed. I was traveling with my son visiting Southern Methodist University and the tour was at 10AM the next day so we just wanted some sleep. We arrived at the hotel, which is a nice looking brick building up against the freeway and the checked in at the virtually silent hotel. First impressions was that the lobby was nice and clean, possibly recently renovated/new and typical of this hotel type. There are marble floors, some white wainscoting, tan walls, and warm fabrics in the lobby. We drove the car up into their complimentary parking structure on the side and went to our room, by this time at 1:10AM. I was very upset to find the room had a horrendous smell of smoke and I noticed it was the only room on the hall without a no smoking sign. I had specifically asked for a no smoking room and they insisted the hotel was non-smoking, which I though was the case, but I did not know why this room did not have the no smoking sign. I had to walk down the long hallway (it was pretty far to an elevator), get a new key, sign some new forms, and then walk back to move to the room next door, which was fine and had no smell of smoke. The rooms are modern, spacious, and new. We had a guest room style where a modern sofa with a pull out bed is first and then there is a wood cabinet separating it from the area where the bed is. It was a nice room overall. The only downside was the loud noise from the freeway which disturbed my sleep a little. I recommend leaving the fan in the bathroom on to cover up the freeway noise. It was a decent stay, but average. The only things I didn't like was the eggs at the continental breakfast, the loud freeway noise, and first getting a smoking room (avoid room 506, 504 is fine.)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, well-executed”
Reviews.Author: JJNOLA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very convenient. Easy access to/from US75 (North Central Expressway), North Park Center, and SMU. I went to downtown museums, bars in Deep Ellum and Cedar Springs, the Galleria, Richardson, etc are all were within a 15 minute drive. My room (338) is a smaller "studio" suite, I think. Not huge but certainly adequate with a great flat-screen TV which turns to face either the bedroom OR living area, a small-but-complete kitchen and a nice bath with marble vanity. Nice-sized walk-in closet, too. Parking is free. Breakfast is free. Evening cocktail reception is free. Local calls are free. And the hotel is very clean. Excellent overall!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KevinTexas
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice with functional spaces and large, well-planned rooms. All rooms have a small kitchen inside. From the outside the hotel appears fairly new. The inside has been freshly renovated. Check In/Parking/Common Spaces: The person who checked me in was not rude, but not overly helpful. The lobby area is nice with new furnishings. Check in was quick. The parking garage is gated and a room key is needed for access. The building is easily accessible from the attached garage. The breakfast is a nice, basic continental. The evening managerâ€™s reception is ok with beer, and various snack items. Room: I had the one bedroom suite during my stays. The living area features a full sofa w/pullout bed and 42â€� LCD TV. The kitchen has a microwave, two burner stove top, full refrigerator, and plates, pans, etc. The room also has very nice granite counter tops in the both the kitchen and bath. The bedroom had an LCD during one stay and a tube TV in another (BOO!). The Hyatt bed is very comfortable and I had a king both times. The bathroom has a garden tub, although it doesnâ€™t look like it was part of the renovation, so donâ€™t expect extended soaking. All and all this is a great property in a great location near Northpark Mall. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a "suite" experience”
Reviews.Author: Generic90
Reviews.Content: During a consulting project in the Dallas area, me and several business colleagues moved to this property from perhaps the worst Marriott property in the world (just up the expressway). After that experience, any property would have been great, but the Bradford turned out to be a most welcome change for the remaining two months we were on this project. The suites we had had the feeling of apartments, and were largely quiet. I had a suite on the interior section, with windows facing the central pool/courtyard area. The suites were exceedingly spacious, with a nice living area, kitchen area, bedroom, and bathroom. Storage space was more than plentiful, which was good for long stays. There were TV's in both the living room and bedroom, though the cable options were a bit limited. There was a very basic VCR in the living room, which was a nice touch, but would be better utilized if it were a DVD player instead. The bed was a tad firm, but otherwise comfortable. Kitchen appliances and tools were ample, and allowed more flexibility for dining in. A nice feature of the suites were that the in-room phones had their own separate numbers with a voicemail inbox that could be set up with a personal greeting. This made it nice for people to contact you, as they did not have to go through the front desk to be transferred to your suite. The pool facilities were nice, though could get busy and noisy if a lot of kids were around. The fitness facility was small, but functional. The laundry facility was more than satisfactory and contained several washers and dryers, so it was near-impossible to ever have a wait to wash clothes. The facility was clean, safe, and secure. Room keycards were needed for access to the parking garage, and to enter the main doors in the overnight hours. The facility is in a safe area, within easy walking distance of a Tom Thumb grocery store, Barnes & Noble, restaurants, and the North Park Mall. It is also within easy driving distance of other area shopping and attractions. The front desk staff was helpful, if unspectacular, in their customer service. I did not have any encounters with the housekeeping staff, though they kept the suites clean and well-stocked. Another nice feature in regards to housekeeping is that the rooms were serviced twice a week, and the guest could "customize" the days that they wanted that service to occur. In my last couple of weeks at that property, they were beginning a renovation of some rooms and other parts of the facility. I have since learned that ownership of the property has changed. I hope that the good standards were maintained in this upgrade and change, because for the price and quality, this was a very good long-term stay facility in the Dallas-Fort Worth area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel; Few Complaints”
Reviews.Author: af847
Reviews.Content: This place was recently updated. Good location (make sure you map the nearby highway interchange and streets or you may get lost!) and the rooms have a nice kitchen, bathroom, sitting area and flat screen TV. Nice closet too. Breakfast is included and is pretty good. It's all neat and clean, if a tiny bit dark and dingy at times. Good value and nice staff. Near a nice mall and Blue Mesa Grill; you should eat there if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Would not return”
Reviews.Author: SuiteCase
Reviews.Content: Our stay was comfortable because of the location, covered parking, full size refrigerator, quality pots/pans/dishes, and great service people that work there. The bed and bedding including the pillows were very uncomfortable, considering the "Bradford Suites" is touted as an upscale extended stay hotel. The bath room sink is a strange miniature size that I have never seen before making it uncomfortable to shave in. Also, the furniture was stained and well worn, definitely in need of replacement. The complimentary breakfast was very low grade quality, soggy-days old fruit, stale pig-in-blanket. The picture of the room on their website is nothing like the room you will get, so look around. I didn't know that you could post pictures here, so I'll make sure to post some tomorrow after we check out. We found a great place for half the price at the Candle Wood Suites. They don't have a breakfast or luxury lounge room but the rooms are nicer and more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business and budget travelers”
Reviews.Author: rwg_24
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed one night at this hotel after attending my nearby company Christmas party. Since we didn't feel like dropping over $200 for a night at the hotel of the party, I booked a night at the Bradford for a mere $99. The hotel staff was very friendly and accomodating. Facilities were in great condition. The free attached parking garage was a plus since it was raining the night we checked in. Nice free continental breakfast buffet in the lobby the next morning. Our room had all the amenities you would need if you are a business traveler or someone in need of a cheap stay such as we were. Kitchenette, huge refrigerator, high speed internet, 100 TV channels, etc. Room was very clean. My only complaint that keeps me from giving it a 5 is that the bed was not that comfortable and the sheets felt like they were disposable and made of paper.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Finley90
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night to see a Stars Hockey Game. Hotel is located within walking distance of the American Airlines Sports Center. We found the room to be clean and very nice. There was a large HD flat screen TV available. There was a microwave, refrigerator, and electric stove top. The rooms looked to have been updated. There was some construction on the ground floor that did not bother us at all (we were on the 2nd floor). The only negative would be the breakfast which because of construction I believe was served on a tiny shelf. There were the usual rolls, juice, etc. Nothing really special but it was there. Would stay again if in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “No phone service?!?”
Reviews.Author: TexasTrippin
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for out-of-town family - and the hotel will not answer their phones! I have called the number for two hours now. I confirmed the local phone number with the Bradford Homesuites national reservation number - they also attempted to call the hotel also with no success. My family members don't have a cell phone so I CAN'T GET IN TOUCH WITH THEM... Moreover, look at the hotel's web site - they don't even list a fax number for the hotel. This is simply unthinkable. I have no idea what has gone wrong with their switchboard/front desk clerk but it is amazingly frustrating and even a safety issue, I would think.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: TanyaP
Reviews.Content: This is a good location for people like us who need quick access to the SMU area. It's a good value, too. Agree with other reviewer that the wood blinds are nice, but allow daylight in a bit earlier than we wanted. Our suite was clean and comfortable. Liked the amenities in the small kitchen. Bed and bathroom were comfortable. However, the AC went out on day 2 and mgmt. did not fix. They moved us to a Handicapped accessible room (the only other room open). A hassle. While that room was well equipped for disabled, it was a lot smaller than our original suite and no effort was made to credit us. We would stay there again because of its location, covered and free parking and homey amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Would be great, but.....”
Reviews.Author: pmn
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very conveniently located off 75, minutes from SMU, just around the corner from NorthPark Mall (which is HUGE! Bring your hiking boots) and a small shopping center with a Cheesecake Factory restaurant (recommended), Barnes and Noble, and grocery store. While the location was hard to beat, we will not be staying here again. There were good things about this hotel, and the price was reasonable, but the bad outweighed the good for us. Plusses: Our suite was immaculately clean and quiet, (no overuse of air-freshener); the bed was comfortable; the kitchen well-equipped; the service was friendly; parking was in a key-card secured garage connected to the building. The minuses: The wood blinds, while pretty, let in way too much light--- we were all up at the crack of dawn. I certainly wouldn't have been able to nap during the day. I just can't imagine hotels not having block-out curtains in their rooms nowadays. The breakfast buffet wasn't that great--- I've certainly seen better at hotels much cheaper than this. The Nintendo controller was in the bedroom portion of the suite. We had hoped to let our children play in the den area (where the fold-out couch was) while we watched TV in the bedroom. Not possible. And the pool---- it was FREEZING! And this was late September in Dallas! The highs all week had been in the 90s, but you couldn't even let your legs dangle in the water in the afternoon, that's how cold it was. The pool is in the center of the courtyard, blocked on all sides duing the day by the 4-story building, so it only gets direct sunlight for a few hours each day. Our children were extremely disappointed, as hanging out at pool was going to be a big part of our long weekend. I couldn't believe how cold it was. I'm not sure if it's heated at other times of the year, but it would HAVE to be, if it was this cold in September. You might want to check on this if you intend to swim. We wish we had--- this alone would have made a huge difference in our satisfaction with the hotel. So, in short, if you're not planning to swim, and are using this as a business hotel and have no intention of sleeping in, this hotel might be a fine choice for you. We will look elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: agentaustin
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Bradford a number of times. We have been happy with facilities. The room was clean, the breakfast good (and usually available earlier than scheduled), and the staff friendly. The hotel location is good, too, near North Park Mall, right on Central Expressway and very near our daughter's apartment. This time, we had a room on the top floor in the corner overlooking the pool. There are other better locations. The pigeons were roosting on the ledge outside of the window and their cooing was a bit intrusive. Also, there must have been an ac unit above us as we heard it turn off with an audible bang throughout the stay.. We would definitely stay at the Bradford again. We just will ask for a non corner room on a lower level.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay”
Reviews.Author: Trekmom02
Reviews.Content: This was our third time to the Bradford Homesuites Lincoln Park and our first time in a one bedroom accommodation. And, once again, we enjoyed our stay. The staff was very pleasant, the breakfast enjoyable and the bed comfortable. I do miss the nutragrain bars, though. I understand too many of them were wasted and they no longer have the complimentary bars in the kitchenette. Too bad. We will be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: yvonnefov
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at the Bradford. Staff were friendly and helpful, rooms above average and great breakfast. Location is good,great restaurants nearby. Would strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here several times over the last three years. Rates have been reasonable, secure covered free parking is a plus. Nice continental breakfast (need to add donuts!). This is where we regularly stay. Stayed there last month-- will be there again this month.

Reviews.Title: “Very snobby for so-so service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel many times. Love the room, love the location (used to live in Dallas near this location). Don't like some of the staff attitudes. I've asked for a later check out, desk staff acts like its a big deal. Their check out time is 11:00, only asked to stay until 12:30. During my last stay they had a water problem that wasn't mentioned at check in. No water from 10am to 4pm!!!!! No discount on the room. Still got the snobby attitude when I asked to stay until 12:30. Bradford should offer some perks for loyality especially for this so-called boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “As good as expected”
Reviews.Author: ChefGeorge
Reviews.Content: We just stayed one night last weekend, so had none of the problems mentioned with multi-day stays, internet, etc. The staff were perfectly friendly, the space was attractive, neat, and clean, everything worked, and the breakfast buffet, with hot Mexican scrambled egg breakfast tacos, was well above average. Free garage parking was very convenient, as is the location to Central Expressway, NorthPark Mall, etc. It's not The Mansion, but for the price I think it's very fine.

Reviews.Title: “"F" in Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I don't recommend this hotel. They have nothing to offer but a decent rate. The employees were average at best. The "free" breakfast and better rate caught my attention, but I'll look elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “wouldn't return”
Reviews.Author: kauai744
Reviews.Content: don't stay here. i ended up here as a result of their downtown dallas location "bumping" me with a confirmed reservation held with a credit card. upon arrival at lincoln park (6 miles out of my way), the room i was sent to had not been cleaned. the noise from the floor above was unacceptable for a business traveler. the high speed internet connection was slower than most dial-up connections i've had, and housekeeping kept rewashing the same (clean) dishes every day. the staff appeared totally disinterested in guest satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: “OK experience, decent value”
Reviews.Author: JayinNY
Reviews.Content: This facility is a good choice for business or other travellers who want a large unit with cooking facilities. I have stayed here twice, once in a junior suite (no separate bedroom), and once in a full suite (with a separate bedroom). The units were roomy and clean, had a basic kitchenette, and a large desk area that would be useful for business travellers. They were decorated rather plainly (walls were a very depressing grey beige color), and hence had a somewhat spartan feel. There was a outdoor pool, a business center, and a small 24 hour store where some drinks and foodstuffs could be purchased. There was a decent buffet breakfast in the morning. Hotel services were not extensive, but staff was professional and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Bradford does not treat its guests well and I do NOT recommend staying there. The front desk does not communicate well with housekeeping, so they will throw away your items if they think you have checked out, even if you haven't.
